trans-unit.source: Represents an x-, y-, z-, and w-coordinate point in world space used in performing transformations with non-affine [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)] matrices.
In XAML, the delimiter between the values of a Point4D can be either a comma or a space.
Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character.
XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter.

You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a Point4D in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a Point4D attribute value into its components.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` -or- ``` ## XAML Values *x* The component of this Point4D structure.
*y* The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A> component of this Point4D structure.
*z* The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A> component of this Point4D structure.
*w* The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A> component of this Point4D structure.
Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The z-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The w-coordinate of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to add.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to add.
Returns the sum of point1 and point2.

Determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure and if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W*> properties of the specified <xref:System.Object> are equal to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W*> properties of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
If `o` (the passed object) is not a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> structure, this method returns `false`.

Because a <xref:System.Double> value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> values that are logically equal might fail.
The object to compare.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
if o (the passed ) is a structure and is identical with this structure; otherwise.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structures for equality.

Because a <xref:System.Double> value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> values that are logically equal might fail.
The instance of Point4D to compare to this instance.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structures for equality.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> structures are equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A> properties are the same.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to compare.
if the , , and components of point3D1 and point3D2 are equal; otherwise.
Returns a hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
Returns a hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to transform.
The transformation <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Returns the result of transforming point and matrix.
Translates the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure by the specified amounts.

Note that calling the Offset method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A> properties directly.

Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object.

If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs.
Similarly, calling Offset on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object.

If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> back to the property or indexer.
The amount to offset the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The amount to offset the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The amount to offset the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The amount to offset the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W*> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to add.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to add.
Returns the sum of point1 and point2.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> structures are equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A> properties are the same.

Because a <xref:System.Double> value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> values that are logically equal might fail.

The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to compare.
if the , , and coordinates of point4D1 and point4D2 are equal; otherwise, .
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structures for inequality.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> structures are not equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W%2A> properties are different.

Because a <xref:System.Double> value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D> values that are logically equal might fail.

The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to compare.
if the , , , and coordinates of point4D1 and point4D2 are different; otherwise, .

The transformation <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
Returns the result of transforming point and matrix.

Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to subtract from `point1`.
Returns the difference between point1 and point2.
Converts a <xref:System.String> representation of a point4D structure into the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The <xref:System.String> representation of the point4D structure.
Returns the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to be subtracted from.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure to subtract from `point1`.
Returns the difference between point1 and point2.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.IFormattable.ToString*>.

A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.

The default value is `0`.
Gets or sets the X component of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.

The default value is `0`.

The default value is `0`.

The Z component of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> structure.
The default value is `0`.
